text: Excellent food - take this from an Indian foodie!! I Tried vegetable Thali - chotey, saag paneer, daal, Raita, hot naan and rice along with chopped onions and pickle

I went there yesterday with a friend. We had samosas, which were very tasty and original. However, we were very disappointed with the Vegetarian Thali. Only the naan and the raita were good, the chick peas, spinach and the other dish all tasted badly. I had the feeling that it was just warmed up processed food. I am used to better Indian food, even in cheaper restaurants.

YAaaaaaaK place for indian food !!!

Damn expensive , & worst food ever in the entire nation !!!

Spoiling the name & fame of the country !!!

They dont offer a cup of water to their customers & rather guide them to the fountain near the restroom !!!

No star at all

Amazing fast food. We got the gobi manchurian; it is delicious! They also have full vegetarian plate. I'm coming back for that next time! The waiter told us they switch out the curries so you will get a different mixture everytime.
Really tasty food. We got the chicken biryani, and the Chicken Masala. They were super delicious, and the chicken was well marinated and spiced.

I can't even give this place a star. Not my first time eating Indian food. I'm from a very heavily populated Indian area back at home with many above standard dining options. This place did not fit the mold in the least. I ordered 2 dishes...Tandoori Chicken and Sheekh Kabob..the Tandoori Chicken was dry, not made to order and cold with a foul odor and taste. the Sheekh Kabob which was questionable as well and was in fact not a kabob. After 3 bites I knew this food was going to end up making me sick due to the fact that it was not fresh but rather food that had been sitting out for hours. The naan was also served cold and not included with our food when buzzed for pickup although it was already paid for. 

The service was worse than the food! When I ordered I received nothing but rude mannerisms from the cashier who failed to do her job efficiently and felt the need to express her frustration with the customers. No matter how polite I tried to be and I'm a very patient person,this cashier continued to be rude. After realizing the food was no good I immediately brought the food back to the counter and demanded a refund. The cashier explained she would need to get the manager..she returned moments later with no manager and stated there was no manager. When I demanded a refund for the full amount paid of $25 dollars she refused and proceeded to call mall security!!! She then moved the tip jar from the counter. I could care less about the tip jar but mall security!!!?!! Security explained I had to fill out a report and make a complaint to the corporate office via guest services. After doing so I have mixed feelings and do not feel I was treated fairly. I will not return to this mall either being that ceases palace is only a hop skip jump away with better shops and food court options. Beware!
Excellent vegan options! The Aloo gabi, vegetable samosas and naan were all great! Full of flavor and a good quantity of food for the price. Highly recommend.

This place is simply amazing!! I was a big fan when they were at the riviera and im super excited about this new location as well....I have to say this location is much nicer and cleaner than the Riviera...but the food is the best part which continues to be transferred over.....we visit vegas for work and this place is our absolute go-to.....they have the best south indian dishes!!! The Masala Dosa is my most fav!!! The staff is friendly and the service is good too.....A must try for anyone who like indian!

The food is really good and always tasty. It's also consistent I've been here a couple of times and they have had a consistent taste. The reason for my 3 star review are the portions, they refused to add an extra meat option. The cashier one time told me she would note it on the ticket since they didn't have it as an option she couldn't charge me for it but she would note in the ticket and see what the cooks say, when I went to get my food I asked the cook and he said yes there's extra but then looked at the cashier with a displeased look in his face and told her next time tell them no. I'm not asking for free I'm willing to pay, the lack of options provided for adding extra has driven me to write this in hopes of they change this.

I'm always picky about Indian food outside India because it's not usually good. And sadly, good Indian food is hard to find in Vegas. But India Masala turned out to be a hidden gem with great food and excellent service. The vindaloo chicken and the lamb kebabs were especially great! Definitely plan to go back on my next Vegas visit.

I came to las vegas for a quick business trip over the weekend and was looking for some great indian food but i did not have enough time to go to a nice sit down place. THEN I FOUND THIS PLACE in the fashion show mall none the less, best location for any tourist to come. Not only was the food served to me fast but it was so fresh and it tasted amazing. 

I ended up getting the non veg combo platter ( which included chicken tikka masala, chicken curry, rice , naan and some lentils)  since i wanted to try a little bit of everything and i also got a samosa chaat with an ice cold mango lassi. I must say for all this food it was reasonably priced , especially for the location on the strip. 

i will definitely be coming back to india masala on my next trip.

The service it was amazing the food was amazing everything was amazing so happy they open this place at fashion show especially since I switch to vegetarian some times there is plenty of options I will be going back again and again and again
Horrible food and worst customer service.Ordered thali it was tasteless and looked like two days old.please do a favor for yourself by not visiting this place.

Good Indian place in food court. Paneer butter masala and Shahi paneer were awesome. Naan is great. Thali is not recommended, instead go for individual entree which includes rice and naan. Gobi manchurian was disappointing.
This place provides good service.

We happened  to eat  here while on vacation which offers good Indian food although little expensive , we stayed in Trump International which is just opposite to the mall entrance . 
I ate lunch combo or thali on one day and masala dosa on the next both tasted good enough ,we even tasted biryani which is fair enough but not authentic .We hadn't had quite a chance to dine in other Indian restaurants , so I could not conclude whether it is the best Indian food or not but a good place to eat in when really hungry n craving Indian food .
Best Dosa place in Town... Good thing is Fashion Show mall and prices are very Affordable.

I was so relieved to find out that India's Masala had finally reopened. It used to be in the Riviera food court (the only reason to even go to the sad Riviera), but since its closing, they have finally reopened in the food court of Fashion Show mall. Being new, the little stall is much nicer than their space at the Riviera, with more attractive design. I have to admit, the only thing I ever get is the masala dosa. South Indian food is hard to find in the U.S., so whenever I do find it I am excited. Their dosa is very good, not the best I've had, but much better than you'd expect from a food court.  I also get the mango lassi, which is excellent. I haven't tried the curries yet. Someone else at the counter was picking up naan on my last visit and it looked buttery delicious. I will have to try it on my next visit. Just so glad they've reopened!

2 and 1/2 star actually.

This was the first Indian meal of the long trip we had planned.  It took a little while for us to figure out that this restaurant was in the food court of Fashion. The Gobi Manchuria could have been better. We had ordered the Veggie Thali and it was ok. Dosa was ok as well.
We came at 8:40 and they say they are closing and only have limited menu. We walked all the way to get disappointed.

We used to visit this place when it was in riviera. It was one of our fav then. However they moved to fashion show mall and we visit there again but this time it was okay experience. We order samosa, medu vada and dosa. Samosas and medu vada was surely not fresh, felt it was refried and old from last day. Dosa was good though. Also the price have gone up.

This is one of the few vegetarian options in the Fashion Show Mall food court, and it's super tasty! I had palak paneer. It was well-seasoned, a tiny bit spicy, with generous chunks of paneer and served with nice, airy long-grain rice and a piece of tasty buttered naan. There is even a vegan option on the menu, the aloo gobi (cauliflower and potato dry curry). The service was friendly and efficient. Tip -- if you want water, ask them for the sparkling water / club soda from their soda fountain (which they provide for free) rather than filling your cup from the water fountain around the corner.

I love this place! I loved them at the Riviera and I'm so happy they set up here at Fashion Show Mall. Seriously, THE BEST Indian food in Las Vegas! Never disappointed with chicken biriyani. I used to love the Goa chicken curry as well.

Good Indian place on the strip. Tasty food.     Decent service. It's in the food court in the mall. Use the escalators in front of Wynn and go up to the third level. When we used google maps it took us to the mall entrance and from there it's a long walk!

Service is very slow and food is not that great. But its an oasis for the people looking for indian food in the strip. We have tried masala dosa and its decent and better than many places I have tried in US but biryani is awful. I think it may please americans who like non spicy food but definitely not Indians. Biryani has that typical taste where they cook everything separately and just mix it for the customers when ordered. Its quite expensive too!
Nice food , quick service and ideal location . Worth trying Indian food here . Deducted one star as it seemed little pricey .

Me and my friend were shopping in fashion show mall in the strip LV and  surprisingly found an Indian restaurant fast food type in the food court.. Everything we ordered tasted good and the service was super fast even when it was busy when we ordered. Prices were cheaper than many other indian eateries. Will definitely recommend if ur craving for some south indian fast foods type food.

I decided to give them a try while we were in vegas recently. i ordered chicken tandoori that comes with rice and a side of garlic naan. When my food arrived, I found the chicken to be not cooked enough so I sent them back to the girl at the counter and told her that there were still some reddish colour in the middle of the chicken pieces. To my surprise she asked, "do you them well done?". I'm not sure if she was just surprised that I asked the chicken to be cooked more or if she was really serious. I shall give her the benefit of the doubt! lol. Anyways, about 15min later she signaled that my food is ready (again) so I went to the cashier and was told that the cook decided to make me a new order altogether and this time the chicken were thoroughly cooked.

As an employee of fashion show mall~ it's awesome that this location offers a mall employee discount on my order!  Also, every time I order lunch from here I always get the best service from Monica!

She takes the time to explain the dishes if I have questions about ingredients, or how they're prepared.  I also saw her give exemplary customer service to a customer who was being less than polite to her in front of me in line. 

The selection of dishes are bountiful and I have yet to try more of the delicious looking menu.  Looking forward to trying them all!   If you're in the mall and looking for something fresh, hot and delicious- give India Masala a try!

Really good food, It is in the food court of fashion show mall. We had chicken madras curry,Chloe bhatura( garbanzo beans with puffy bread) a must try, mango lassi. Portions are large. If you are in vegas you must try this place or if you are local I am sure you will get hooked to their food. I recently moved here and I go there almost every weekend. Prices are fair. Customer service is awesome as well. They will answer all your questions. Btw they have this South Indian corner in their menu, every item is a must try.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

For an Indian fast food place, they have done a very good job with providing freshly cooked delicious options. 

They are located in a food court so there is not much they can do about the plates and tables and everything else. They nailed it with their delicious food. We had ordered two items from very different parts of India and they both turned out to be very good. 

I would have placed this my top recommendation on the strip for Indian food.

Very authentic and delicious Indian food ! Madras curry was stunning. Very courteous folks and quick in delivery.

Thank you ! We enjoyed.

-Shandy

visited vegas during christmas and spotted this place. very decent food and portion size in the prices. 
Tried 2-3 different vegetarian options, north indian food was good, but south indian was disappointing (we tried medhu vada and sambhar). 
we ordered only north indian when we revisited
Loved their mango lassi
Entire food court was super crowded and this place had huge queue before we could order. But that did not stop us from revisiting this place

Had the goat biriyani for $15 but serving size was HUGE.  Tasted good and had nice flavor; my only complaint would be that the bay leaf was in pieces scattered throughout which I had to keep spitting out. Raita on the side was good; however I wish it was just a tad colder since I'm a pansy when it comes to spicy foods in general.  
Ordered a side of naan which came out toasty, warm and fresh.  

Overall, good authentic food for a relatively low price.

I have been a big fan of this family owned spot since the were at Rivera Casino (now closed). They have really amazing Indian food, affordable and variety of choices. They are supper friendly and your food will be ready real fast. Now at their new location in Fashion Show mall, they continue their great service in the open good court area. If you're in Vegas and you're craving for some good, flavorful and afford Indian, you should check out India Masala, you won't be disappointed.

Nice food. I loved the taste. Reducing one star for the timings which I guess has to do with Mall but common guys its Vegas and we need it 24x7 specially over weekends. 
Also , the Chai is amazing at this place.
Food was really good I tried the #7 one I wish the serving is more more RICE please lol anyways an then my friend got the number #12 it's really good too price is decent and the order came fast

(I think I'm being trolled by one of the workers lol after my Yelp review) 
15$ all I got was sauce. Barley had any chicken. It was tasty but not worth the price. They don't even give out ice water. Would I eat here again? probably not. Would I recommend it. Only if they were vegetarians and had money to waste. This place isn't bad but I been to other restaurant on the strip if I were to recommend one, it would be Bombay Indian Cuisine for the same price you can get a buffet and your money worth.
One of the worst on the strip. Don't even dare to try this restaurant. Their cook doesn't know a bit of cooking Chicken tikka.

I was craving some Indian food and decided to try this place at fashion show mall. I have to say not for just a fast food but compared to all other places I've tried in town this was the most authentic and tastiest. We decided to try the tandoori chicken, masala dosa, Chole bhature, and chicken madras curry and we just couldn't decided which was better! Everything is amazing and the service was equally good. Rahul the cashier suggest all the dishes and I'm glad we listened to him. Thanks Rahul for your great recommendations!

Trying this place for the first time and didn't expect this place to be this good! The food was awesome!! I ordered chicken tikka masala and it's really delicious, it's not to overwhelming with the Indian spices, it's just the right amount of it. If I come back to Las Vegas, I'll definitely be back here again.

This food stinks and the service is worse than that. I don't even know where to start. All the food was cold and what really ticked me off is they don't serve water when you order. Not a fucking cup of water ?!?! Are you serious? This is Las Vegas first of all and second of all after spending 60+ dollars at your restaurant you can't give me a fucking cup of water? Smh I don't even want to continue writing or it'll be bad.


03/08/2016 
I'm back here for dinner with my family. Decided to give another try. And bunch of sh** still don't offer water. Bought 50$ worth of food asked for water and they say "here is a cup there's a water fountain by the bathroom" freaking a-holes. I won't be giving my business to people like this ever again. "Fool me once shame on you. Fool me twice shame on me."  Villa pizza right next door gave me 5 cups of nice iced water with no hesitation. On top of that you can tell the food is old and its served cold. The sauces taste like the frozen ready to eat sauces you can get at any Indian market. Learn how to run your business. Sorry not sorry.

Located inside the Fashion Show's Food Court, this is one of few places where you can eat Indian while on strip. I was visiting with family and all they eat is Indian so we had to come here daily. We ordered the veg thali both times and it came out okay with 1 naan, rice, 3 veg dishes (paneer, daal, chole). Chole bathure also were decent. It's a self serve joint in the mall so I didn't have much expectations to begin with. Overall, if you are on the LV strip craving Indian...go here.

Came to this place on wimp as we wanted to eat Indian while we were on the strip. This isn't a sit down place its located inside the fashion mall next to zara in the food court. We ordered papdi chaat, chole bhatura, thali and mysore masala dosa. Chole bhatura was decent so was the thali but Mysore masala dosa wasn't cooked properly or even crispy but the sambar was good. Papdi chaat was ok since the papdi wasn't big enough it felt more like they had fried tortillas and cut it into small pieces. It wasn't bad for LV and decent if you just want to grab and go. It was a little pricey so I would recommend going to a traditional Indian place as it would be cheaper to get buffet than ordering 5 different dishes.

I have eaten a decent amount of Indian food in my life and their Chana Masala is on par with many really good Indian restaurants. The Naan was also very fresh and delicious. When I visit Las Vegas next I will come back again.
Only if u cant live without indian food go for this place... waste of money if u r here for craving dosa or other indian food... 2 star for just having the shop in malls.. thnx for that..

For an Indian place in a food mall, this place is fantastic!!!!
Worth the wait for your food. 
Best Indian I've had in a while. Spicy and flavorful. 
So good!

I'm a local and live in summerlin. My boyfriend and I drive across town just for the food at India masala inside the Fashion Show Mall. We pass at least a dozen Indian food places on the way. Chicken korma is a must try. As well as the chicken biyriani! Great food and fast service. If your looking for great Indian food. You must stop by here!!
Love this spot. Best Indian Food in Las Vegas. I am addicted to the paneer butter masala and am here at least once a week. Monica always remembers my order and gives me lovely service!

The India Masala in fashionshow mall food court has some of the best Indian food in las vegas.  I am a local and brave the traffic and tourists just to eat here.  With my love of trying new things this place has a large variety.  One of my favorite parts to coming here is the great courtesy that meets me at the counter.  Her name is Monica and her smile a great attitude keeps me coming back.  Give it a try, you will not be disappointed.
This is my second time at this place. Amazing food, full of spices. Goat biryani is a must to have. In vegas if you have a craving for indian food, this is a must go.

Had the spicy Chicken Madras, which was basically a curry dish, served with rice and naan.  Also ordered a side of the yogurt sauce.  Portions are huge.  Food was really good.  I had been craving Indian.  This scratched an itch.

Amazing taste and real quick service. We took chhola bhatura and veg thali. Both were good. Bhaturas were so soft and yummy. They also give lemon, onions , pickle and green chillies with food which is the icing on the cake!

This is fast food Indian food located in the mall food court, but it doesn't taste like fast food. There's a wide variety of menu options to choose from, but I stuck with my old standby, chicken korma. It was about a pint of chicken korma with rice and naan as well. The heat level was just right. Definitely check this place out. The food was good and the price was right :)
Best naans ever with spicy indiuan food, just at the strip. Must visit place for casual lunch/dinner in the food court.
We visited this place for the first time and food is really awesome..the best in Vegas..!!

I got the tikka masala it was good had just the right amount of spice. My first time having Indian food so I don't have much to compare it to, but it was enjoyable I'm glad we found it. The naan bread was huge and tasted amazing!

Moderate to good food if you are looking for fast n quick indian food on the strip located on the 3floor of the mall 
 Serving is quick and taste is okay

I was not expecting this food court place to be so good. It wasn't the best Indian food I have had but it was really tasty and very fresh! It is a cool concept too, sort of a full service restaurant meets food court where you order then they give you a buzzer and you wait about the time it would take to make your food had you been in a sit down place, so it is made fresh and tasty! 
I actually think it is a cool concept other places should/ could adopt.
The food was good but not as richly flavored as a few of my favorite Indian places, and I chose mild spice because it is usually still quite spicy, but here I think I would opt for Medium since the dish we got had no spice to it at all, but that is just a preference thing, sort of like how different brands of clothing fit differently. 
We got the butter chicken, my personal favorite Indian dish, and an order of their vegetable samosas. The Chicken was tasty and tender and their rice was good too. The samosas unlike the chicken were quite spicy, they were rich in flavor and served piping hot! They serve them with the two traditional dipping sauces, one a sweet tamarind sort of sauce and the other a green earthy tasting sauce. 
The naan we got with the meal was just okay, and sort of had a pretzel bread flavor to it I didn't care for. It was also thinner than most naan I have had before, and no real depth of flavor. 
Overall it was good, and certainly the best quality place in this food court, if I was in the mall and it was meal time I would likely consider ordering from here again.

Meh. It's ok. Chicken tikka was dry and flavorless. The curry madras was pretty good. We also got the non vegetarian combo platter. That was really good but kinda pricey for strip mall food at 14.99. It's not fast food either. Takes like 10-15 mins to make. There doesn't seem to be a lot of Indian options in Vegas and near the strip. The chicken masala was probably best. The naan is really good too. They don't offer ice water but they will give you a cup to fill up at the water fountain near the bathrooms lol.

One of the very best. We had the vegetarian thali. The selection is wide and the taste authentic. The lady at the counter is very knowledgeable about the ingredients and could answer all the minute details that I usually need before I order food. Would visit again.

Hands down the best Indian food you can find within a two mile radius of the strip. I am extremely picky when it comes to Indian food but this place won my heart. Disclaimer : I only tried Vegetarian food here. Vegetarian Thali (fixed three entrees - palak paneer, chana masala, and dal makhni), Chana Bhatura, and Gobi Manchurian. All are great options! Gobi Manchurian was better than any I've had in the United States. Conveniently located in the food court of the Fashion mall in front of Wynn hotel on the strip, this place is a gem. I am so glad I found this place...So much so that I am writing this review as I finish my first meal!

Really gone downhill since leaving Riviera.   Used to go several times per year when in Riviera and butter chicken was always fantastic.  It's clear that they've switched over to the cheapest low quality chicken they can find.  First time I ordered butter chicken in the mall, there was almost no chicken.  It was just a few chicken shavings no wider than the tones on my fork.  Second time each piece of chicken was attached to big wads of fat.  Third time, there was fat and a bunch of hard slivers of what appeared to be bone or cartilage.  Overall, the food is disgusting.  Really disappointing what the owners have let happen to a formerly terrific restaurant.

I had to wait for a long time for Indian fast food over 15 minutes. The nan bread was the best part fluffy with some crispness to it. The curry was cold to the touch and was extremely greasy. The curry was very flavorful. The portions were on the large side and it was served with a lot of rice which was drowning in butter or oil.   I'm not in a rush to come back.

We had been to the India Masala in the Riviera before it was demolished, and really enjoyed it.  So when we found ourselves in Vegas for a relatives birthday, we thought we'd hit up this location for lunch.  It was not a bad call.  The food was delicious with just the right amount of heat, and service was friendly.  The only down side is that we weren't expecting a buffet, so we didn't get to order our favorite dish (there's traditional dinner service, but lunch is a buffet).  Still, it was excellent.  I'd definitely eat here again.
This place has amazing food! I had their Paneer Butter Masala and it was very delicious! I would come here again.

Really good food, authentic Indian food I would say. We tried the Veg thali and the Veg Biryani, both of them were really yummy. The server Aliya was also very kind and helpful. Considering the cost, quality and service I would definitely recommend this Fast Food joint.

Food was so so at this place and kinda pricey too but the only thing they need badly is customer service. None of them greet you or even smile. Maybe you have to pay for their smiling too I guess....lol

I thought the food here was actually quite decent given its mall food court status. I got the butter chicken with rice and naan, and the flavors were quite good. The chicken was a tad bit stringy and dry, but the curry itself was flavorful and tasty. Both my dad and sister liked it. The naan was so fluffy and slathered in butter. 

I thought the service could have been better. The girl was a bit disinterested and sounded annoyed that I was asking her really basic questions about the menu ("What's in the thali?"). Also, if you want water, they will give you a cup and direct you to fill it in the water fountain around the corner. I would almost rather they just say no, no water. Filling it at the water fountain was weird, especially since the water didn't taste that great.

Amazing place to eat at. My first time eating real Indian food was here at India Masala and started an addiction. started from eating samosas every day as a snack (GREAT VEGAN OPTION AND IM NOT EVEN VEGAN) Also had the masala dosa, tikka masala and the butter chicken, ALL FIRE. i'm ready to try any and all of their options whenever i get the chance. Awesome customer service from them every single time as well.

This was my first time trying Indian food, and wow I'm impressed how this fast food Indian restaurant is surprisingly good! I have so many great things to say about this place. First off, the service is excellent! The cashier was kind enough to let my boyfriend & I try the sauces out since it was our first time ordering Indian food. I had no clue what to order, so she recommended the Chicken Tikka Masala w/ the Garlic Naan. I also tried the Vegetable Samosa.. So tasty & flavorful. This place is amazing and will not disappoint! I most definitely will be returning very soon! :)

I ordered the non-vege Thali which is overpriced, in my opinion at $14.99 for a combo. I got my food and the naan bread had about 2 tsp of oil on top of it, and my chicken tikka masala had only ONE piece of chicken in it! The chicken curry and tikka masala were bland! I was thoroughly disgusted by the whole experience. (Oh, and the guy at the counter mumbled and I could hardly understand him.)
Sad. Didn't like the Indian food. I was longing to eat good Indian food. Truly left disappointed.  Also the Quantity was little . And the food was not delicious.

I just had chana masala (chickpea curry'ish dish). It was so good and so fast!!! The staff was super helpful in selecting a vegan dish and it was done in about three minutes. Love this place and definitely going back.

It's too worst restaurant, they don't even know what food items they are making. Chicken Biryani, I never have such kind of biryani, it's not biryani, chicken pieces are dry and hard, rice was not good, funny and  one of the worst part was they add lemon pickle on top of it.

What a ripoff!!!!
 paid $12.99 for tikka masala , I got something like soup with 4 little chicken cubes.

It was worth walking 20 minutes to reach the place...
I ordered vegetarian Thali and Mango Lassi
Must try for sure :)

Excellent Indian Food in a Fashionshow Mall across from Wynn. Presentation was good. Both Veg and Non-Veg Thali's provide excellent choices. One comment to the owner's - if someone asks for a glass for water - please be courteous and provide one. There is no reason to promote water bottles.

At Fashion Show Mall food court, i always eat at India Masala simply because their meals aren't greasy like all others there, plus they serve some grain soups. Monica at the register, is always alarmed for your order, to convey it to the kitchen, grab and serve it to you in no time. (This place also gives you buzzers notify you) She will take her time to tell you about the ingredients and makings of the dishes as well.

I was recommended this place by friends who said the dosas and chai were authentic Indian. I have to say, I didn't care for the food at all. 

I ordered the plain dosa which came with a delicious cold coconut sauce. The sambal and salsa sauce were not tasty. 

Also ordered the Gulab jamun dessert which was ok. I've had way better elsewhere. 

The chai tea was the most disappointing as I was really looking forward to tasting the cardamom and ginger flavours of india. 

Finally, I tried an order of plain butter naan and garlic naan which were tasty on their own. 

I realize this is at a food court so expectations need to be kept low.

Not bad for fast food. 

Inside the fashion show mall, this was a bit pricey at $12.99 for a chicken tikka masala, but the dish was a good size and the naan was big and fresh, and of course, it's Vegas!

The chicken was a bit tough/overcooked but the sauce was ok. The naan was definitely my favorite.

Last month we visited this place for the lunch time and they have buffet going on. We just tried their buffet and everything was really good.
They have something with medu vada with yogurt and it's really good.

For a food court on the Vegas strip the food was really good. I had the chicken biryani which was really good and the price was no bad @ 10.95.

They also have several thalis which come with a nan, rice and 3 types of curry which was good. really enjoy eating some Indian food right on the strip.
Very impressed with the high quality indian food at a food court. I ordered the chicken tikka masala and nan, so good!! I am indian and approve :)

Amazing taste. Yummy paneer butter masala and butter chicken. You must try it.
This like a home for me now as I am in town for business every two months.

Real Indian taste.

Try it once!!! You might make a trip to Vegas just to eat here. If you are a foodie.

Parijat Hande
From Pune India
Had a gr8 experience! Sarav was really nice ! We had dinner on feb 10th 2016 & went back coz of Sarv & had brunch before heading back to L.A .

We came here once, while on a five day vacation to Vegas, and we just continued to come here for almost all meals. I loved the vegetarian thali, chole bhaturas, chicken biryani, seekh kababs. Sweet lassi and mango lassi are not that great. But chai is good. Prices are decent as compared to what you have to pay for everything at Vegas. Location is also great as the fashion mall is quite close to all hotels at the strip! For a fast food place, it really was above our expectations.

Great indian food at Fashion show mall.Awesome taste  and authentic indian food
Had Chole Batura/idli/chicken curry/chicken chetinad/mutton biryani

All above items were 5* except biryani would be 3.5*
Not to mention their Tea , it was nice
I'm not a big fan of the Indian food been since I eat in that place I absolutely love it that's the only Indian food  place that I really love

I don't normally come to a mall to enjoy good food, but the Fashion Show Mall finally has quality food in their food court! Every mall has a Panda Express as their "ethnic" food, but for once another culture is represented. 

My friend usually orders my Indian food for me, but since I was alone I didn't know what to order. Monica was really nice and let me try 3 of their top curry sauces. I ended up ordering the palak paneer because it was the lightest in taste; it wasn't too spicy but has the perfect amount of flavor. 

Palak paneer is a vegetarian Indian dish consisting of spinach, tomato gravy sauce and paneer in a thick paste made from pur√©ed spinach and seasoned with garlic, garam masala, and other spices. My dish came with firm tofu pieces, rice, and a HUGE naan. 

Overall: the food was delicious, the portion was fair and worth the $11.99, and the customer service was great!
Excellent . They have a wide selection for the lunch buffet and include a drink.. also they make fresh naan and dosa to order .. it's excellent

Very good vegan options if you're looking for a quick bite while shopping. Their aloo gobi is the best and most flavorful I've had. Lots of onions and spices! They have one soup which is very nice and somewhat spicy as well.
Delicious Indian food that you get instantly, no wait. Try everything here it's all amazing. Masala Dosa with buttermilk is delicious

Wow. Very surprised. Simple and flavorful - real Indian food. Even my parents liked it and they are hardly ever happy with takeout Indian. Even the lassi wasn't too sweet. Better than the Indian restaurants we tried too.

There aren't that many highly rated Indian restaurant on the strip (so it seems - please message me if am wrong) so we went for what, according to other yelpers, was above average. First, it turns out that this place is inside a mall and is part of the food court ensemble. This is not obvious from the address. Nevertheless, we waited to be delighted by some savory Indian food but left with a rather mixed score. I ordered the vegetarian thali which is served with three side dishes, yogurt, pickle, rice, and a naan. 
Let's start with the good. The naan was really thin, crisp and yummy. A perfectly charred creation from the clay oven. Yogurt raita was fine as well. Mango lassi was simply marvelous. The three dishes - Chick peas, Saag, and Lentils - were surprisingly sub-par. For one, they were served a bit cold. Second the saag and chick peas just didn't have any zest and tasted very "formulaic" with no character. None of the flavors really stood out. Almost as if the cook's heart was not it. 
Serving was quick - it's after all inside a mall's food court.  We just wanted something within walking distance this time but will dig deeper for good Indian food on the next trip.

I was starting to crave some Indian food and I walked up to the counter to read the menu items. After standing at the register for a solid 3 minutes, the young man at the register never offered to answer any questions or even acknowledge me. I asked him what size cup is available for the mango lassi, and his apathetic answer was "About a 12 ounce?" ... I pointed at the soft drink cups and said "so roughly that size?" and he only goes "yeah something like that"

It would've. Just been easier to grab a cup for your lassi and show me? He was too busy on his cell phone, though.

My first time to  this outlet and I must say it was really a pleasant experience. Strolling down the mall, on business, lunch time in the foodcourt was India Masala. 

A clean tidy Indian fast food operation, with a pretty extensive menu to suit all Indian style taste buds. We tried the Masala Dosa (this is the second time in this week for me) - and my friend order the same too.

Very good quality, at an inexpensive price, the dosa was crisp and filling was true to the Indian flavor, accompanied by sambar and chutneys - both very good. 

I strongly recommend visiting India Masala, foodcourt when you are there. Its probably the best food in that foodcourt, all other outlets look really tried 

Good work
The food is not great, but good for a one time snack. We got the Veg thali, Chole bhatura, Nan and Sabzi, Gulab jamun and chai. The quantity was okay, less than most Indian restaurants. Overall, meh!
Food was great! This place is inside the fashion show mall. Way better than the hotel's food I stayed in.

This place has great food, absolutely delicious and authentic Indian cuisine.  This is real food and not the typical fast food you find in the mall.  I was surprised that the food quality and taste is fantastic for being in the mall food court.  My favorite is the tandoori chicken, butter chicken, and mango lassi drink.
Mediocre Indian Food. Good Quantity, poor quality.

I was pleasantly surprised!  After a long morning of shopping, we started getting hungry.  The other restaurants in the food court seemed questionable and so we decided to take a chance here and I'm happy we did.  The butter chicken curry was DELiCIoUS.  Perfectly seasoned with just the right consistency, it was actually better than a lot of the other Indian restaurants I've been too!  
The naan and rice were a great complement to the curry and it left me wanting more.  I'll be back.
The food is average..Malai paneer and Malai kofta is good..  i would recommend it to check out once.
Food is awesome, but the service is really bad,i ask for water she gave me water cup and told me to filled out from around the corner from water tap that was not really nice
Great food . Best environment . I wish I should have gone the few time but never mind. It's always another time.

This is one of Fashion Show mall's food court shacks, I admit that I went in with low expectations, thinking that a food court restaurant will probably not offer typical Indian food. I was wrong, there Chicken Masala in on par with any good Indian restaurant. The Tandoori bread was also fresh and authentic. Their menu offer other classics, kabob and such. I would come back try the rest.

I had been going to this place for some times now.  They used be in food court of Reviera Hotels and Casino on South Las Vegas Blvd aka The Strip.  Now they have relocated to The Fashion Island... But the teast and service remains same.  

I had ordered Butter Paneer Masala with rice and naan... It was delicious! My wife and dad had Dosa...and my daughter had Chole Bhatuda... ALL GONE!  Their Chicken is also excellent.  

However, they can improve their Chicken 65 dish... it was little too dry...The best Chicken 65 I had was in Atlanta (next to The Patel Brothers...there is Indo-Chinese Fusion place).

None of less, the service and staff are very friendly and excellent.  One major improvement is now they have eBuzzer... so when your order is ready...the assigned buzzer  goes off... they dont scream/yell your name in speaker when your order is ready! 

India Masala...you will always be my GoTo place....

Thanks
Cheers!

The butter chicken and naan bread is a must have on their menu. They give you a nice portion size too. Easily one of the best Indian restaurants on the strip and it's inside the Fashion Show mall so who doesn't like that?! Customer service is always the best too.

Food is good. Not the greatest but good. 


The girl on the other hand is rude. Came here the other day and was VERY unsatisfied with her attitude, she is not welcoming. Gave it another try today, surprise surprise she is still rude. Interesting business model, no wonder it isn't very busy. How disappointing

Trying this place for the first time and let me just say this, it won't be the last! It was like love at first sight! Delicious food indeed! Don't even get me started with service, their team offer variaties of recommendation from mild to hot depending on your taste bud feels. You might even spot your favorite dish in their menu. Easily accessible from the 3rd floor food court and with the big sign, it'll he hard to miss AND resist!
Food is awesome. Authentic Indian food. The service and the staff wasn't  that friendly and customer centric but food is awesome.
Though it was in a mall food court, it was surprisingly good. more authentic and better tasting than the other one we went to in the strip. Quantity was good too. will definitely go again.

Having food here for second time. They have really very good and tasty food. Mine favorite Gulab Jamun was better than my expectations.
Sometime the waiting would me more at peak hours. Except that its awesome.
One fo the best place to kill your hunger with satisfying your taste buds. Thank you guys. You are doing good job.

We randomly went to this place twice for dinner & lunch buffet while on the trip to Vegas.

Dinner:

We ordered Malai Kofta & Paneer tikka masala, and both were just awesome. In fact, Malai kofta was almost equivalent to the Indian taste.


Lunch buffet:
Everything was good in lunch buffet but I would strongly recommend their Saag Paneer, Goat Biryani (recommendation from friends) & Kheer. Naans were so soft & delicious.
This place is inside fashion show mall on level 3, food court. The food is okay. I have had better, but given the place and location it'd not that bad.

Really good, given that this is in a food court in a shopping mall, so some things can't be evaluated in the way that they can with a brick and mortar restaurant. 
Naan is often weak at mall Indian restaurants, but is good here.
I found a whole Caradamom pod in (I think) my rice, which made me very happy. One of the indicators for me of good Indian food is the presence of these little flavour bombs. 
I've eaten at this place for a few years and don't vary my purchases much. Aloo Gobi (today) and Palak Paneer being my standard go-to items. 
Pleasant service, tasty food (on the mild side, but again at a mall in the US, to be expected), and a pretty large serving size (I struggled to eat it but I am on the smaller side).
I was irritated with them on the day before Memorial Day when they seriously shrank their menu, around 7pm but they have fully redeemed themselves. 
From my limited but lengthy knowledge of this place I will be a repeat customer for as long as they are here with this management.

Beware guys they lie about halal food!! My friend worked at this location and she told me when the customer ask if the food is halal they say yes but it's not they tell the workers to lie. Both the locations..all the authentic halal meat sellers in Las Vegas have a certificate. And they don't!!!

Now with a location inside the food court in the Fashion Show Mall, India Masala turns the food court into something else--something better, and I'm really liking it! 

1. They give you a buzzer while you wait for your food so you know exactly when it's ready to be picked up! The only place in that upstairs food court to do this. 

2. It's fast food, but doesn't really taste like fast food. It feels like you're eating a real lunch/dinner, rather than something super greasy or oily or slapped together quickly. 

Now, it's not the best Indian food that I've ever had, but it is fairly priced and they give you a good amount of food, too. 

One thing that I have to mention is that, while my chicken tikka did taste pretty good, it was very over-seasoned. While I don't exactly mind, other people might, so I suggest brushing the spices off or just letting them know--hey, this might be a litteeee overboard. 

Even still; India Masala is, so far, the best food in that food court!
Had chicken tikka masala and it was really good. The price wasn't expensive the whole plate was 12.99 and it came with rice and 1 big naan. Yumm
Otherwise good food is made up for by HORRIBLE service and dismissive attitude of teen at the register.

Today..we Had ..Indian food in India Masala...it was in the fashion show mall .....it was really good food -- fresh -fast -n taste is so good ...chicken tikka masala is my favorite...my friends had lot of different stuff ...they had tandoori thali ..n cholle bhatura...n more .....we'll share and all the food was really good .......n simply ..we can say ...its was really good food ..and they also gives u a good quantity of food ...I definitely want to go again ..!""
Ok food, not authentic south indian. Food was half done. I enjoyed their food when they first opened outside the strip. But the food in the food court was not up to the mark.

Surprisingly tasty....go for it !!!
I ordered for Choley Bhature and mango lassi and both were tasty... Food was very fresh and perfect amount of spices used in Choley. Bhatura were soft and not at all oily ...
Being an Indian I can say u will not be disappointed to eat here
This place charges me 10 and some change for Takla chicken to only receive 6 piece. I would have when to panda or anywhere else. The people here was so rude I will never come here again.

Vegetarian review: I wish I had known this place existed a few days ago. The food was tasty and the quantity was sufficient for the price. We had the masala dosa and the vegetarian thali. Both were well cooked, not too spring, and filling. For an Indian place in a shopping mall, this was excellent! I wish we had something similar in Texas.
Super tasty food. Veggies samosa are my fave!! Monica normally helps me and she's a super sweaty!!! Def try this spot if you are at the mall!

So good!! I just had a vegetarian lunch...a big pancake of rice and lentil dough with veggies in it and it came with phenomenally good vegetable soup which was perfectly spicy for me who lives spicy food as long as it's not extremely hot. Bookmarking this place for my next visit to Vegas.
Food tasted ok but not great..customer service was just fine but they did not have any enthusiasm. This is not the best place if you want to taste some authentic delicious Indian food

Excellent, excellent, excellent! Delicious meal considering it's from a food court. I got the Vegetarian Thali for lunch and had enough leftover for dinner that night. I'd go back first thing the next time I'm in Las Vegas!

Located in the food court. 

As expected food court food prices will be elevated

Food: 4/5
-at $12.99 you get a large naan, generous rice and cubes of chicken tikka masala
-the masala was a bit closer to a watery consistency than a creamy consistency
-wish there was a bit more protein for the price point
-entire meal was closer to $15 after tax and a drink. I'm thinking a buffet may have been a better choice
-food is made to order so expect a wait

I am certain that the owners of this place do their best to provide their customers a great Indian style meal and great service, however, when the cat's away the mice will play. 

I approached the counter 10 minutes before they close and asked if I could get a plate. I ordered a palak paneer  and asked if it was spicy, which she immediately said no, charged me turned away and dismissed me. No time to order a drink or anything else. 

I really needed that drink because the food was spicy as heck and it ruined the whole meal and experience. I was so close to go back to the counter and just leave the tray with the food there, but decided not to make a scene. 

You might want to hire more customer service oriented staff if you want to avoid reading comments like this! 

Namaste!

I love indian foods but best place in city India masala.
Good price, good customer service, fast food, tasty .
I recommend this place to having a amazing indian meal
Don't miss it. First of all i have to tell customer service s the best .  happy customer

Before I tell you guys why India Masala in FashionShow Mall is a must go to, let me ask you this. Who doesn't like Indian Food?! Their entire cuisine is a gift for the brilliant flavors they put together to produce excellent dishes for us to consume.

Being said that, I've been dining here for as long as I can remember. And nothing has changed. Excellent food, awesome customer service and most of all, very convenient in terms of access. It's located at the 3rd floor food court and trust me, it'll stand out from it's competitors!

They offer tons of food selections as well as drinks! Best sellers are usually marked on the menu as well! The food is filling, very worth it for its price. You get quality and most of all, a happy stomach!

I highly recommend this place to anyone who's willing to learn about the culture and discover awesome food!

Shouting out Monica DiDi and their entire team for always recommending me with spectacular food!

The food is average, what I really disliked is that they refuse to give even a cup of water with the food. I guess they really want to extract the cost of drinks from you (which is overpriced). Also, they change extra for using the card. The person at the counter was far from pleasant.

Never go here below is the review 

Chai was cold

Panner Butter masala tasted like it was 2 or 3 days old and served to me just by heating it up

Thali which my wife tried was horrible

Only good thing was Naan
